title: Welcome & Setup
exercise: Download your Challenge Roadmap. Read it tonight. Set your starting-point scores and get oriented.
description: For the next 21 days, we're going to reset three key areas of your life: your finances, your body, and your mindset.

title: Reset Your Mindset
exercise: Write down one area where you've been cycling (money, fitness, stress). What's your honest baseline right now? Don't judge it. Just name it.
description: Most of us live in a yo-yo: we spike, we crash, we promise to restart. Today we reset the narrative.

title: Financial Pillar — Peace of Mind Account
exercise: Calculate your baseline monthly needs: housing, food, utilities, essential transport. Write it down. That's your Peace of Mind number.
description: We're building a Peace of Mind Account — a separate savings bucket that exists for one purpose: to cover 30 days of your basic expenses.

title: Physical Pillar — Establish Baseline
exercise: Track three things for the next 7 days: (1) daily steps or movement minutes, (2) one meal per day, and (3) sleep quality (1–10 scale). Just observe.
description: Your baseline is: how much movement are you doing right now? How's your energy? Your sleep? Your basic nutrition?

title: Psychological Pillar — Stress Architecture
exercise: For three days this week, note: What triggered stress? How did your body respond? How did you recover (or not)? Write it down.
description: Stress architecture = the invisible patterns that trigger your stress, the way you respond, and the recovery (or lack thereof).

title: Integration — Three-Pillar Snapshot
exercise: Write one sentence for each pillar about your baseline. Example: 'Financially, I need $3,500/month to feel stable. Physically, I'm moving 4k steps/day. Psychologically, Monday mornings are my stress trigger.'
description: Your financial stress often shows up as physical tension. Your sleep baseline impacts your spending baseline. We're optimizing one life with three dimensions.

title: Weekly Reflection
exercise: Write down three things you noticed this week about your baseline. It could be a surprise, a pattern, or just a clearer number than before.
description: Reflection isn't just feel-good journaling. It's the pause that lets you actually integrate what you've learned.

title: Foundation Recap
exercise: Pick one baseline number from this week (your Peace of Mind number, your daily step goal, your stress trigger). Write it somewhere visible. That's your anchor.
description: In seven days, you've done something most people never do: you've gotten honest about where you actually are.

title: Financial — Spending Baseline
exercise: Pull your last 30 days of spending. Categorize into: Essentials (needs), Comfort (small pleasures), and Leaks (recurring charges you forgot about).
description: Most of us spend money on autopilot. Today we make it conscious.

title: Physical — Deepening
exercise: Take your baseline movement from week one. Add 5–10% to it. If you were at 5,000 steps/day, aim for 5,250.
description: Baseline bending works because it's gradual. Your body resists extreme change. But 5% more movement? Your body can do that.

title: Psychological — Stress Response as Data
exercise: Pick one stress trigger from last week. Write down: (1) the trigger, (2) your physical response, (3) what you needed in that moment.
description: Instead of fighting your stress response, let's learn from it. Your stress response isn't broken. It's information.

title: Turbocharge Protocol Teaser
exercise: Review your three-pillar baseline from Day 5. Where's the biggest opportunity for a 15% improvement?
description: Starting Day 15, we introduce the Turbocharge Protocol — a three-day framework that creates a rapid-iteration cycle.

title: Tracking System Audit
exercise: Set up your tracking for the next three days: one column for financial, one for physical, one for psychological. Use whatever tool feels natural.
description: You don't need fancy apps. You need clarity. Simple tracking beats fancy apps every time.

title: Midpoint — Corporate Soft Mention
exercise: One reflection: What's one thing you wish you'd had clarity on earlier? That's the thing worth building systems around.
description: You're halfway through the challenge. Clarity changes everything.

title: Midpoint Reflection
exercise: Write down three specific changes you've noticed since Day 1. Then write one thing you want to nail in the final seven days.
description: In two weeks, you've mapped your baseline across three pillars. You're not the same person who started 14 days ago.

title: Turbocharge Protocol — Part 1: Alignment
exercise: Look at your three pillars. Identify one place where they're working against each other. Write down one small fix for each connection.
description: Making sure your financial baseline, physical baseline, and psychological baseline are working together, not against each other.

title: Turbocharge Protocol — Part 2: Optimization
exercise: For each pillar, write down your 15% move: one spending leak to cut, one movement adjustment, one stress-response change.
description: What's one 15% improvement in each pillar that you can execute right now?

title: Turbocharge Protocol — Part 3: Lock In
exercise: For your three 15% moves, write down: How will you do this automatically? System beats willpower. Always.
description: Turning those 15% improvements into habits, systems, and daily routines. Not through willpower. Through design.

title: Habit Stacking
exercise: Identify three existing routines (morning coffee, lunch break, evening wind-down). For each one, write down one new habit you'll stack onto it.
description: Habit Stacking = linking a new habit to an existing routine. Don't rely on motivation. Routines are permanent.

title: Setbacks & Reset Protocol
exercise: Write down your Reset Protocol in one paragraph. What do you do when you slip financially, physically, or psychologically?
description: You're going to slip. That's not failure. That's data. The Reset Protocol is what you do when you slip.

title: Fusion Formula
exercise: On one sheet of paper, write: My Peace of Mind number is $___. My daily movement baseline is ___. My stress reset routine is ___.
description: The Fusion Formula is your complete operating system for the next 90 days and beyond.

title: 90-Day Plan & Pathways Forward
exercise: Read all three pathways (Solo, 401Grow for business owners, Build More Margin for teams). Which resonates?
description: In 21 days, you've built a complete framework. Now comes the real question: How do you sustain this? And what's next?
